titleStmt.title: The amorous old-vvoman: or, 'tis vvell if it take. A comedy. Acted by His Majesties servants. Written by a person of honour.
titleStmt.author: Duffett, Thomas.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A36755 of text R214579 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing D2443A). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 155 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 40 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The amorous old-vvoman: or, 'tis vvell if it take. A comedy. Acted by His Majesties servants. Written by a person of honour.
titleStmt.author: Duffett, Thomas.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Simon Neale at the three Pidgeons in Bedford-street in Covent-Garden,

notesStmt.note: Reissued in 1684 as: The fond lady.
The final unpaginated leaf contains the epilogue.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

ep:epHeader.ep:title: The Amorous Old Woman, or 'Tis Well if It Take
ep:epHeader.ep:defectRangePerGrade: The rate of 34.88 defects per 10,000 words puts this text in the C category of texts with between 10 and 35 defects per 10,000 words.
